question: What food was once believed to cause leprosy?
funFact: Potatoes were once believed to cause leprosy in Europe. People were afraid to eat them for centuries, even though they're now a staple food.

question: What food was once believed to be poisonous?
funFact: Tomatoes, potatoes, and eggplants were all once considered poisonous because they're part of the nightshade family. People were afraid to eat them for centuries.

question: What food was once believed to have contraceptive properties?
funFact: In ancient times, carrots, parsley, and dill were all believed to have contraceptive properties. Women would eat large amounts hoping to prevent pregnancy.

question: What food was once believed to cause flatulence?
funFact: Beans, garlic, and onions were all once believed to cause flatulence in ancient times. They were banned for priests and other religious figures.

question: What food was once believed to contain souls?
funFact: Beans were once believed to contain souls in ancient Greece. Followers of Pythagoras refused to eat them, thinking it was a form of cannibalism.

question: What food was once believed to be an aphrodisiac?
funFact: Oysters, chocolate, and ginseng were all once believed to be aphrodisiacs. People would eat them hoping to increase their libido.

question: What food was once believed to cure the plague?
funFact: Garlic, onions, and herbs were all once believed to cure the plague in medieval Europe. People would carry them or eat them hoping to ward off disease.

question: What food was once believed to prevent scurvy?
funFact: Citrus fruits, potatoes, and cabbage were all once believed to prevent scurvy. Sailors would eat them on long voyages to avoid the disease.

question: What food was once believed to be a cure for all diseases?
funFact: Honey, garlic, and ginger were all once believed to be cures for all diseases in ancient times. They were used to treat everything from colds to serious illnesses.

question: What food was once believed to make you immortal?
funFact: Peaches, ginseng, and mushrooms were all once believed to grant immortality in ancient China. People would eat them hoping to live forever.

question: What food was once believed to give you super strength?
funFact: Spinach was once believed to give you super strength because of a decimal point error in nutritional data. Popeye the Sailor Man helped popularize this myth.

question: What food was once believed to be the food of the gods?
funFact: Ambrosia, nectar, and honey were all once believed to be the food of the gods in ancient mythology. They were thought to grant immortality and divine powers.

question: What food was once believed to ward off evil spirits?
funFact: Garlic, salt, and herbs were all once believed to ward off evil spirits. People would carry them or place them around their homes for protection.

question: What food was once believed to make you smarter?
funFact: Fish, nuts, and berries were all once believed to make you smarter. Modern science has actually found some truth to these beliefs, as they contain brain-boosting nutrients.

question: What food was once believed to make you live longer?
funFact: Yogurt, green tea, and olive oil were all once believed to make you live longer. Modern science has found some truth to these beliefs, as they contain health-promoting compounds.

question: What food was once believed to be a poison antidote?
funFact: Milk, honey, and charcoal were all once believed to be poison antidotes. People would consume them hoping to neutralize toxins, though modern medicine has better treatments.

question: What food was once believed to cure baldness?
funFact: Onions, garlic, and herbs were all once believed to cure baldness. People would apply them to their scalps or eat them hoping to regrow hair.

question: What food was once believed to improve eyesight?
funFact: Carrots, bilberries, and fish were all once believed to improve eyesight. While carrots contain vitamin A which is good for eye health, eating them won't give you super vision.

question: What food was once believed to make you invisible?
funFact: Mushrooms, herbs, and potions were all once believed to make you invisible in folklore. These beliefs were part of ancient magic and mythology.
